meanings.definition: To place special stress on; emphasize.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overaccentuate her achievements when talking to her friends.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overaccentuate certain details in the presentation.
meanings.sent3: He always overaccentuates his jokes, making them even funnier.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement overaccentuates her bubbly personality.
meanings.sent5: The artist's use of color overaccentuates the emotion in the painting.

meanings.definition: To make something seem more important or noticeable than it really is.
meanings.sent1: The advertisement tried to overaccentuate the benefits of the product.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes people tend to overaccentuate the negative aspects of a situation.
meanings.sent3: His attempts to overaccentuate his wealth were quite obvious.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech overaccentuated the impact of the new policy.
meanings.sent5: The lighting in the room overaccentuates the shadows, creating a dramatic effect.
